Skip to contents
REUMDAC 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Queries the EUMETSAT Discover API

    discover.Rd

    Discover EUMETSAT Data Store Earth Observation data at the collection level.

    Usage

    discover(hits_only = FALSE)

    Arguments

    hits_only

    Return details of the hits only

    Value

    If hits_only is FALSE, the entire response is returned as an R list, otherwise only the details of the hits.

    Examples

    discover()
#> $took
#> [1] 4
#> 
#> $timed_out
#> [1] FALSE
#> 
#> $`_shards`
#> $`_shards`$total
#> [1] 5
#> 
#> $`_shards`$successful
#> [1] 5
#> 
#> $`_shards`$skipped
#> [1] 0
#> 
#> $`_shards`$failed
#> [1] 0
#> 
#> 
#> $hits
#> $hits$total
#> [1] 145
#> 
#> $hits$max_score
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $hits$hits
#> $hits$hits[[1]]
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_index`
#> [1] "csw"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_type`
#> [1] "record"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_id`
#> [1] "EO:EUM:DAT:0082"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_score`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "Release 1 of the Fundamental Climate Data Record (FCDR) of the Meteosat Visible and Infrared Imager (MVIRI) onboard the Meteosat First Generation (MFG)  provides georectified, recalibrated, and consolidated Level 1.5 data of the visible (VIS), infrared (IR) and water vapor (WV) bands along with all metadata, spectral response functions (reconstructed for the VIS channel), as well as calibration information to compute radiance, brightness temperature and reflectance. The VIS band data are provided along with detailed measurement uncertainties and error correlation information. As further elaborated in the Product User Guide, the files are provided in FIDUCEO EASY and FULL (only available on special request) netCDF4 formats.\r\n\r\nRelease 1 of the MVIRI FCDR consists of data from the Meteosat-5 satellite with nominal sub-satellite longitude 63 degrees. Release 1 was produced as part of the FP7 ERA-CLIM2 and H2020 FIDUCEO project."
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$access_constraint
#> [1] "copyright"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$alternateTitle
#> [1] "MTP15FIDE0100"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$availability
#> [1] "Download"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$availableFormats
#> [1] "netCDF4"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$availableFormatsVersion
#> [1] "-"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$conditions
#> [1] "-"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$coverage
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$coverage[[1]]
#> [1] "Regional"
#> 
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$creation_date
#> [1] "2020-09-07"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$dataCiteIdentifier
#> [1] "10.15770/EUM_SEC_CLM_0013"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$datasetLanguage
#> [1] "eng"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$datasetTitle
#> [1] "MVIRI Level 1.5 Climate Data Record Release 1 - MFG - 63 degree"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$datasetTitleNormalized
#> [1] "MVIRI Level 1.5 Climate Data Record Release 1 - MFG - 63 degree"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$dateStamp
#> [1] "2022-02-24"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$degree
#> [1] "false"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$format4DataCite
#> [1] "false"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$filenameConvention
#> [1] "FIDUCEO_FCDR_L[level]_[sensor]_[sat]-[subsat_long]_[starttime]_[endtime]_[representation]_[processor-version]_[format_version].zip(*D2F1)"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$fileFormatDescription
#> [1] "This is sent in a compressed Submission Information Package (SIP) by default."
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$typicalFilename
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$typicalFilename[[1]]
#> [1] "FIDUCEO_FCDR_L15_MVIRI_MET5-63.0_200004301100_200004301130_FULL_v2.6_fv3.1.zip"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$typicalFilename[[2]]
#> [1] "FIDUCEO_FCDR_L15_MVIRI_MET5-63.0_200004301100_200004301130_EASY_v2.6_fv3.1.zip"
#> 
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$documentation
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$documentation[[1]]
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$documentation[[1]]$description
#> [1] "netCDF documentation and tools"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$documentation[[1]]$url
#> [1] "https://www.eumetsat.int/formats#netCDF"
#> 
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$documentation[[2]]
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$documentation[[2]]$description
#> [1] "SIP documentation and tools"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$documentation[[2]]$url
#> [1] "https://www.eumetsat.int/formats#SIP"
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$name
#> [1] "netCDF4"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$averageFileSize
#> [1] "42"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$averageFileSizeUnits
#> [1] "MB"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$version
#> [1] "-"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$frequency
#> [1] "48 (per day)"
#> 
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$availability
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$availability$protocol
#> [1] "https"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$availability$`function`
#> [1] "order"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$availability$label
#> [1] "Download"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$availability$availability
#> [1] "Download"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$availability$url
#> [1] "https://data.eumetsat.int/data/map/EO:EUM:DAT:0082"
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$distribution
#> [1] "Download"
#>

#> [1] "EUMETSAT"

Tech., 13, 1167–1179, https://doi.org/10.5194/amt-13-1167-2020. http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode isCitedBy http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author Release 1 of the Fundamental Climate Data Record (FCDR) of the Meteosat Visible and Infrared Imager (MVIRI) onboard the Meteosat First Generation (MFG) provides georectified, recalibrated, and consolidated Level 1.5 data of the visible (VIS), infrared (IR) and water vapor (WV) bands along with all metadata, spectral response functions (reconstructed for the VIS channel), as well as calibration information to compute radiance, brightness temperature and reflectance. The VIS band data are provided along with detailed measurement uncertainties and error correlation information. As further elaborated in the Product User Guide, the files are provided in FIDUCEO EASY and FULL (only available on special request) netCDF4 formats. Release 1 of the MVIRI FCDR consists of data from the Meteosat-5 satellite with nominal sub-satellite longitude 63 degrees. #> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$hierarchyLevel
#> [1] "series"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$hierarchyLevelName
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$hierarchyLevelName[[1]]
#> [1] "theme.par.Brightness_Temperature"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$hierarchyLevelName[[2]]
#> [1] "theme.par.Climate"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$hierarchyLevelName[[3]]
#> [1] "theme.par.Level_1_Data"

John, Roebeling, Rob, Hewison, Tim, and Schulz, Jörg  2019: Recalibration of over 35 Years of Infrared and Water Vapor Channel Radiances of the JMA Geostationary Satellites, Remote Sens.2019,11, 1189; doi:10.3390/rs11101189</gco:CharacterString></gmd:name><gmd:function><gmd:CI_OnLineFunctionCode codeList=\"http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode\" codeListValue=\"isCitedBy\"/></gmd:function></gmd:CI_OnlineResource></gmd:onlineResource></gmd:CI_Contact></gmd:contactInfo><gmd:role><gmd:CI_RoleCode codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode\" codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty><gmd:citedResponsibleParty><gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty><gmd:contactInfo><gmd:CI_Contact><gmd:onlineResource><gmd:CI_OnlineResource><gmd:linkage><gmd:URL>https://doi.org/10.5194/amt-13-1167-2020</gmd:URL></gmd:linkage><gmd:name><gco:CharacterString>Liefhebber, F., Lammens, S., Brussee, P. W. G., Bos, A., John, V. O., Rüthrich, F., Onderwaater, J., Grant, M. G., and Schulz, J. (2020) Automatic quality control of the Meteosat First Generation measurements, Atmos. Meas. Tech., 13, 1167–1179, https://doi.org/10.5194/amt-13-1167-2020.</gco:CharacterString></gmd:name><gmd:function><gmd:CI_OnLineFunctionCode codeList=\"http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode\" codeListValue=\"isCitedBy\"/></gmd:function></gmd:CI_OnlineResource></gmd:onlineResource></gmd:CI_Contact></gmd:contactInfo><gmd:role><gmd:CI_RoleCode codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode\" codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty></gmd:CI_Citation></gmd:citation><gmd:abstract><gco:CharacterString>Release 1 of the Fundamental Climate Data Record (FCDR) of the Meteosat Visible and Infrared Imager (MVIRI) onboard the Meteosat First Generation (MFG)  provides georectified, recalibrated, and consolidated Level 1.5 data of the visible (VIS), infrared (IR) and water vapor (WV) bands along with all metadata, spectral response functions (reconstructed for the VIS channel), as well as calibration information to compute radiance, brightness temperature and reflectance. The VIS band data are provided along with detailed measurement uncertainties and error correlation information. As further elaborated in the Product User Guide, the files are provided in FIDUCEO EASY and FULL (only available on special request) netCDF4 formats.&#xD;\n&#xD;\nRelease 1 of the MVIRI FCDR consists of data from the Meteosat-5 satellite with nominal sub-satellite longitude 63 degrees. Release 1 was produced as part of the FP7 ERA-CLIM2 and H2020 FIDUCEO project.</gco:CharacterString></gmd:abstract><gmd:status><gmd:MD_ProgressCode codeList=\"http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode\" #> $hits$hits[[1]]$`_source`$schemaOrgDefinition
#> [1] "{\"@context\":\"http://schema.org/\",\"@type\":\"Dataset\",\"url\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/product/EO:EUM:DAT:0082\",\"measurementTechnique\":\"Optical\",\"copyrightHolder\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"copyrightYear\":\"1998\",\"creator\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"dateCreated\":\"Wed Jan 14 00:05:00 GMT 1998\",\"isAccessibleForFree\":\"false\",\"keywords\":\"GEO,Climate,MVIRI,netCDF4,Optical,Meteosat First Generation (MFG),Fundamental Climate Data Record,Brightness Temperature,Level 1 Data,MFG\",\"license\":\"https://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/terms.faces\",\"publisher\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"schemaVersion\":\"3.5\",\"spatialCoverage\":{\"@type\":\"Place\",\"geo\":{\"@type\":\"GeoShape\",\"polygon\":\"-18.15  81.08  144.15  -81.08\"}},\"temporalCoverage\":\"Wed Jan 14 00:05:00 GMT 1998 / Tue Jan 31 00:12:00 GMT 2006\",\"thumbnailUrl\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/MET7FCDR_63degree.png\",\"encodingFormat\":\"netCDF4\",\"description\":\"Release 1 of the Fundamental Climate Data Record (FCDR) of the Meteosat Visible and Infrared Imager (MVIRI) onboard the Meteosat First Generation (MFG)  provides georectified, recalibrated, and consolidated Level 1.5 data of the visible (VIS), infrared (IR) and water vapor (WV) bands along with all metadata, spectral response functions (reconstructed for the VIS channel), as well as calibration information to compute radiance, brightness temperature and reflectance. The VIS band data are provided along with detailed measurement uncertainties and error correlation information. As further elaborated in the Product User Guide, the files are provided in FIDUCEO EASY and FULL (only available on special request) netCDF4 formats.\\r\\n\\r\\nRelease 1 of the MVIRI FCDR consists of data from the Meteosat-5 satellite with nominal sub-satellite longitude 63 degrees. Release 1 was produced as part of the FP7 ERA-CLIM2 and H2020 FIDUCEO project.\",\"identifier\":\"EO:EUM:DAT:0082\",\"name\":\"MVIRI Level 1.5 Climate Data Record Release 1 - MFG - 63 degree\"}"
#>

#> $hits$hits[[2]]
#> $hits$hits[[2]]$`_index`
#> [1] "csw"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[2]]$`_type`
#> [1] "record"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[2]]$`_id`
#> [1] "EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:MSG15-RSS"
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[2]]$`_score`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[2]]$`_source`
#> $hits$hits[[2]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "Rectified (level 1.5) Meteosat SEVIRI Rapid Scan image data. The baseline scan region is a reduced area of the top 1/3 of a nominal repeat cycle, covering a latitude range from approximately 15 degrees to 70 degrees. The service generates repeat cycles at 5-minute intervals (the same as currently used for weather radars). The dissemination of RSS data is similar to the normal dissemination, with image segments based on 464 lines and compatible with the full disk level 1.5 data scans. Epilogue and prologue (L1.5 Header and L1.5 Trailer) have the same structure. Calibration is as in Full Earth Scan. Image rectification is to 9.5 degreesE. The scans start at 00:00, 00:05, 00:10, 00:15 ... etc. (5 min scan). The differences from the nominal Full Earth scan are that for channels 1 - 11, only segments 6 - 8 are disseminated and for the High Resolution Visible Channel only segments 16 - 24 are disseminated."
#>

The baseline scan region is a reduced area of the top 1/3 of a nominal repeat cycle, covering a latitude range from approximately 15 degrees to 70 degrees. The service generates repeat cycles at 5-minute intervals (the same as currently used for weather radars). The dissemination of RSS data is similar to the normal dissemination, with image segments based on 464 lines and compatible with the full disk level 1.5 data scans. Epilogue and prologue (L1.5 Header and L1.5 Trailer) have the same structure. Calibration is as in Full Earth Scan. Image rectification is to 9.5 degreesE. The scans start at 00:00, 00:05, 00:10, 00:15 ... etc. (5 min scan). Scanning Service</gco:CharacterString></gmd:name><gmd:function><gmd:CI_OnLineFunctionCode codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty><gmd:citedResponsibleParty><gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty><gmd:contactInfo><gmd:CI_Contact><gmd:onlineResource><gmd:CI_OnlineResource><gmd:linkage><gmd:URL>https://www.eumetsat.int/media/45126</gmd:URL></gmd:linkage><gmd:name><gco:CharacterString>MSG Level 1.5 Image Data Format Description</gco:CharacterString></gmd:name><gmd:function><gmd:CI_OnLineFunctionCode codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode\" codeListValue=\"information\"/></gmd:function></gmd:CI_OnlineResource></gmd:onlineResource></gmd:CI_Contact></gmd:contactInfo><gmd:role><gmd:CI_RoleCode codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode\" codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty></gmd:CI_Citation></gmd:citation><gmd:abstract><gco:CharacterString>Rectified (level 1.5) Meteosat SEVIRI Rapid Scan image data. The baseline scan region is a reduced area of the top 1/3 of a nominal repeat cycle, covering a latitude range from approximately 15 degrees to 70 degrees. The service generates repeat cycles at 5-minute intervals (the same as currently used for weather radars). The dissemination of RSS data is similar to the normal dissemination, with image segments based on 464 lines and compatible with the full disk level 1.5 data scans. Epilogue and prologue (L1.5 Header and L1.5 Trailer) have the same structure. Calibration is as in Full Earth Scan. Image rectification is to 9.5 degreesE. The scans start at 00:00, 00:05, 00:10, 00:15 ... etc. (5 min scan). The differences from the nominal Full Earth scan are that for channels 1 - 11, only segments 6 - 8 are disseminated and for the High Resolution Visible Channel only segments 16 - 24 are disseminated.</gco:CharacterString></gmd:abstract><gmd:status><gmd:MD_ProgressCode codeList=\"http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode\" codeListValue=\"Operational\"/></gmd:status><gmd:pointOfContact><gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty><gmd:individualName><gco:CharacterString>European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological #> [1] "{\"@context\":\"http://schema.org/\",\"@type\":\"Dataset\",\"url\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/product/EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:MSG15-RSS\",\"measurementTechnique\":\"Optical\",\"copyrightHolder\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"copyrightYear\":\"2008\",\"creator\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"dateCreated\":\"Sun Jan 13 00:05:00 GMT 2008\",\"dateModified\":\"Tue Jan 26 00:11:00 GMT 2010\",\"isAccessibleForFree\":\"false\",\"keywords\":\"GEO,MSG,Native,Meteosat Second Generation (MSG),Atmosphere,Optical,Ocean,SEVIRI,Level 1 Data,Land\",\"license\":\"https://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/terms.faces\",\"publisher\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"schemaVersion\":\"3.5\",\"spatialCoverage\":{\"@type\":\"Place\",\"geo\":{\"@type\":\"GeoShape\",\"polygon\":\"-65.0  70.0  84.0  16.0\"}},\"temporalCoverage\":\"Sun Jan 13 00:05:00 GMT 2008 / Wed Mar 16 11:47:43 GMT 2022\",\"thumbnailUrl\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/img_msg_rss_onethird_scan.jpg\",\"encodingFormat\":\"Native\",\"description\":\"Rectified (level 1.5) Meteosat SEVIRI Rapid Scan image data. The baseline scan region is a reduced area of the top 1/3 of a nominal repeat cycle, covering a latitude range from approximately 15 degrees to 70 degrees. The service generates repeat cycles at 5-minute intervals (the same as currently used for weather radars). The dissemination of RSS data is similar to the normal dissemination, with image segments based on 464 lines and compatible with the full disk level 1.5 data scans. Epilogue and prologue (L1.5 Header and L1.5 Trailer) have the same structure. Calibration is as in Full Earth Scan. Image rectification is to 9.5 degreesE. The scans start at 00:00, 00:05, 00:10, 00:15 ... etc. (5 min scan). The differences from the nominal Full Earth scan are that for channels 1 - 11, only segments 6 - 8 are disseminated and for the High Resolution Visible Channel only segments 16 - 24 are disseminated.\",\"identifier\":\"EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:MSG15-RSS\",\"name\":\"Rapid Scan High Rate SEVIRI Level 1.5 Image Data - MSG\"}"

#> $hits$hits[[3]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "SLSTR SST has a spatial resolution of 1km at nadir. Skin Sea Surface Temperature following the GHRSST L2P GDS2 format specification, see https://www.ghrsst.org/ . \r\n\r\n- All Sentinel-3 NRT products are available at pick-up point in less than 3h\r\n- All Sentinel-3 Non Time Critical (NTC) products are available at pick-up point in less than 30 days.\r\nSentinel-3 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme."

Skin Sea Surface Temperature following the GHRSST L2P GDS2 format specification, see https://www.ghrsst.org/ . - All Sentinel-3 NRT products are available at pick-up point in less than 3h - All Sentinel-3 Non Time Critical (NTC) products are available at pick-up point in less than 30 days. Sentinel-3 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme. http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode Operational European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT for Copernicus +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode originator originator https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/20170617_sst_slstra_mar-l2p-v1.0__daytime_nrt_ref.png Ocean Sea Surface Temperature Level 2 Data disableCustomizeCart http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_KeywordTypeCode theme - S3A_SL_2_WST____20161019T222429_20161019T222729_20161020T002841_0179_010_072_3419_MAR_O_NR_002.SEN3.zip S3A_SL_2_WST____20161019T222429_20161019T222729_20161020T002841_0179_010_072_3419_MAR_O_NT_002.SEN3.zip MB 20 ~485 (per day)(per satellite) for NRT, ~14 files (per day)(per satellite) for NTC The Sentinel-3 SAFE format wraps a folder containing a collection of measurement and annotation data in binary files (netCDF4 or raw binary based) and product metadata in XML. It is a Sentinel-3 specific variation of the Standard Archive Format for Europe (SAFE). This is sent in a compressed Submission Information Package (SIP). https://www.eumetsat.int/formats#SENTINEL-SAFE SENTINEL-SAFE documentation and tools https://www.eumetsat.int/formats#SIP SIP documentation and tools false http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode series - Sentinel-3 Sentinel-3 SLSTR 2008-06-01 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_DateTypeCode creation SLSTR z551aaa z551aaa http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#CI_SensorTypeCode Optical http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OrbitTypeCode LEO degree 0"

#> $hits$hits[[4]]$`_source`
#> $hits$hits[[4]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "The prime objective of the Advanced SCATterometer (ASCAT) is to measure wind speed and direction over the oceans, and the main operational application is the assimilation of ocean winds in NWP models. Other operational applications, based on the use of measurements of the backscattering coefficient, are sea ice edge detection and monitoring, monitoring sea ice, snow cover, soil moisture and surface parameters. The product is available from the archive in 2 different spatial resolutions; 25 km and 12.5 km. Note that some of the data are reprocessed. Please refer to the associated product validation reports or product release notes for further information. Near real-time distribution discontinued on 29/09/2015 but the product contents are now available in the corresponding Level 2 product 'ASCAT Soil Moisture at 12.5 km Swath Grid'.\r\n\r\nMetop-A data are available in the Data Centre up to 15/11/2021."
#>

Other operational applications, based on the use of measurements of the backscattering coefficient, are sea ice edge detection and monitoring, monitoring sea ice, snow cover, soil moisture and surface parameters. The product is available from the archive in 2 different spatial resolutions; 25 km and 12.5 km. Note that some of the data are reprocessed. Please refer to the associated product validation reports or product release notes for further information. Near real-time distribution discontinued on 29/09/2015 but the product contents are now available in the corresponding Level 2 product 'ASCAT Soil Moisture at 12.5 km Swath Grid'. #> $hits$hits[[4]]$`_source`$location$coordinates
#> $hits$hits[[4]]$`_source`$location$coordinates[[1]]
#> $hits$hits[[4]]$`_source`$location$coordinates[[1]][[1]]
#> [1] -180
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[4]]$`_source`$location$coordinates[[1]][[2]]
#> [1] 90
#>

#> $hits$hits[[4]]$`_source`$location$coordinates[[2]]
#> $hits$hits[[4]]$`_source`$location$coordinates[[2]][[1]]
#> [1] 180

codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty></gmd:CI_Citation></gmd:citation><gmd:abstract><gco:CharacterString>The prime objective of the Advanced SCATterometer (ASCAT) is to measure wind speed and direction over the oceans, and the main operational application is the assimilation of ocean winds in NWP models. Other operational applications, based on the use of measurements of the backscattering coefficient, are sea ice edge detection and monitoring, monitoring sea ice, snow cover, soil moisture and surface parameters. The product is available from the archive in 2 different spatial resolutions; 25 km and 12.5 km. Note that some of the data are reprocessed. Please refer to the associated product validation reports or product release notes for further information. Near real-time distribution discontinued on 29/09/2015 but the product contents are now available in the corresponding Level 2 product 'ASCAT Soil Moisture at 12.5 km Swath Grid'.&#xD;\n&#xD;\nMetop-A data are available in the Data Centre up to 15/11/2021.</gco:CharacterString></gmd:abstract><gmd:status><gmd:MD_ProgressCode #> $hits$hits[[4]]$`_source`$schemaOrgDefinition
#> [1] "{\"@context\":\"http://schema.org/\",\"@type\":\"Dataset\",\"url\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/product/EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:ASCSZR1B\",\"measurementTechnique\":\"Scatterometer\",\"copyrightHolder\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"copyrightYear\":\"2007\",\"creator\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"dateCreated\":\"Mon Jan 01 00:03:00 GMT 2007\",\"dateModified\":\"Thu Jan 21 00:09:00 GMT 2010\",\"isAccessibleForFree\":\"false\",\"keywords\":\"Native,Metop,LEO,Ocean,Radar Backscatter NRCS,Level 1 Data,Scatterometer,ASCAT,Land\",\"license\":\"https://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/terms.faces\",\"publisher\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"schemaVersion\":\"3.5\",\"spatialCoverage\":{\"@type\":\"Place\",\"geo\":{\"@type\":\"GeoShape\",\"polygon\":\"-180.0  90.0  180.0  -90.0\"}},\"temporalCoverage\":\"Mon Jan 01 00:03:00 GMT 2007 / Thu May 26 08:20:33 GMT 2022\",\"encodingFormat\":\"Native\",\"description\":\"The prime objective of the Advanced SCATterometer (ASCAT) is to measure wind speed and direction over the oceans, and the main operational application is the assimilation of ocean winds in NWP models. Other operational applications, based on the use of measurements of the backscattering coefficient, are sea ice edge detection and monitoring, monitoring sea ice, snow cover, soil moisture and surface parameters. The product is available from the archive in 2 different spatial resolutions; 25 km and 12.5 km. Note that some of the data are reprocessed. Please refer to the associated product validation reports or product release notes for further information. Near real-time distribution discontinued on 29/09/2015 but the product contents are now available in the corresponding Level 2 product 'ASCAT Soil Moisture at 12.5 km Swath Grid'.\\r\\n\\r\\nMetop-A data are available in the Data Centre up to 15/11/2021.\",\"identifier\":\"EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:ASCSZR1B\",\"name\":\"ASCAT Level 1 Sigma0 resampled at 12.5 km Swath Grid - Metop - Global\"}"
#> 
#>

#> $hits$hits[[5]]

#> $hits$hits[[5]]$`_score`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[5]]$`_source`
#> $hits$hits[[5]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "The prime objective of the Advanced SCATterometer (ASCAT) is to measure wind speed and direction over the oceans, and the main operational application is the assimilation of ocean winds in NWP models. Other operational applications, based on the use of measurements of the backscattering coefficient, are sea ice edge detection and monitoring, monitoring sea ice, snow cover, soil moisture and surface parameters. This product consists of geo-located radar backscatter values along the six ASCAT beams. The different beam measurements are not collocated into a regular swath grid and the individual measurements are not spatially averaged. The resolution of each of the 255 backscatter values per each beam varies slightly along the beam, but it is approximately 10km (in the along beam direction) x 25 km (across the beam). This product is usually referred to as 'ASCAT Level 1B Full resolution product'. Note that some of the data are reprocessed. Please refer to the associated product validation reports or product release notes for further information.\r\n\r\n\r\nMetop-A data are available in the Data Centre up to 15/11/2021."

Reprocessing Phase 1 - Validation Report</gco:CharacterString></gmd:name><gmd:function><gmd:CI_OnLineFunctionCode codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty><gmd:citedResponsibleParty><gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty><gmd:contactInfo><gmd:CI_Contact><gmd:onlineResource><gmd:CI_OnlineResource><gmd:linkage><gmd:URL>https://www.eumetsat.int/media/37421</gmd:URL></gmd:linkage><gmd:name><gco:CharacterString>Estimation of ASCAT-Normalised Radar Cross Section: ATBD</gco:CharacterString></gmd:name><gmd:function><gmd:CI_OnLineFunctionCode codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode\" codeListValue=\"information\"/></gmd:function></gmd:CI_OnlineResource></gmd:onlineResource></gmd:CI_Contact></gmd:contactInfo><gmd:role><gmd:CI_RoleCode codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode\" codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty></gmd:CI_Citation></gmd:citation><gmd:abstract><gco:CharacterString>The prime objective of the Advanced SCATterometer (ASCAT) is to measure wind speed and direction over the oceans, and the main operational application is the assimilation of ocean winds in NWP models. Other operational applications, based on the use of measurements of the backscattering coefficient, are sea ice edge detection and monitoring, monitoring sea ice, snow cover, soil moisture and surface parameters. This product consists of geo-located radar backscatter values along the six ASCAT beams. The different beam measurements are not collocated into a regular swath grid and the individual measurements are not spatially averaged. The resolution of each of the 255 backscatter values per each beam varies slightly along the beam, but it is approximately 10km (in the along beam direction) x 25 km (across the beam). This product is usually referred to as 'ASCAT Level 1B Full resolution product'. Note that some of the data are reprocessed. Please refer to the associated product validation reports or product release notes for further information.&#xD;\n&#xD;\n&#xD;\nMetop-A data are available in the Data Centre up to 15/11/2021.</gco:CharacterString></gmd:abstract><gmd:status><gmd:MD_ProgressCode codeList=\"http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode\" codeListValue=\"Operational\"/></gmd:status><gmd:pointOfContact><gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty><gmd:individualName><gco:CharacterString>European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological #> $hits$hits[[5]]$`_source`$schemaOrgDefinition
#> [1] "{\"@context\":\"http://schema.org/\",\"@type\":\"Dataset\",\"url\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/product/EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:ASCSZF1B\",\"measurementTechnique\":\"Scatterometer\",\"copyrightHolder\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"copyrightYear\":\"2007\",\"creator\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"dateCreated\":\"Wed Jan 31 00:05:00 GMT 2007\",\"dateModified\":\"Thu Jan 21 00:09:00 GMT 2010\",\"isAccessibleForFree\":\"false\",\"keywords\":\"Native,Metop,LEO,Ocean,Radar Backscatter NRCS,Level 1 Data,Scatterometer,ASCAT,Land\",\"license\":\"https://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/terms.faces\",\"publisher\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"schemaVersion\":\"3.5\",\"spatialCoverage\":{\"@type\":\"Place\",\"geo\":{\"@type\":\"GeoShape\",\"polygon\":\"-180.0  90.0  180.0  -90.0\"}},\"temporalCoverage\":\"Wed Jan 31 00:05:00 GMT 2007 / Thu May 26 08:20:33 GMT 2022\",\"encodingFormat\":\"Native\",\"description\":\"The prime objective of the Advanced SCATterometer (ASCAT) is to measure wind speed and direction over the oceans, and the main operational application is the assimilation of ocean winds in NWP models. Other operational applications, based on the use of measurements of the backscattering coefficient, are sea ice edge detection and monitoring, monitoring sea ice, snow cover, soil moisture and surface parameters. This product consists of geo-located radar backscatter values along the six ASCAT beams. The different beam measurements are not collocated into a regular swath grid and the individual measurements are not spatially averaged. The resolution of each of the 255 backscatter values per each beam varies slightly along the beam, but it is approximately 10km (in the along beam direction) x 25 km (across the beam). This product is usually referred to as 'ASCAT Level 1B Full resolution product'. Note that some of the data are reprocessed. Please refer to the associated product validation reports or product release notes for further information.\\r\\n\\r\\n\\r\\nMetop-A data are available in the Data Centre up to 15/11/2021.\",\"identifier\":\"EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:ASCSZF1B\",\"name\":\"ASCAT Level 1 Sigma0 Full Resolution - Metop - Global\"}"

#> $hits$hits[[6]]$`_source`
#> $hits$hits[[6]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "This is a reprocessed dataset at baseline F06, which is continued by the NRT/NTC data stream from 29/April/2022 onwards.\r\n\r\nAMR-C Level 2 Products as generated by the AMR-C CFI Processor.\r\n\r\nThese products include antenna and brightness temperatures, wet tropospheric correction, water vapour content, and a rain flag. \r\n\r\nSentinel-6 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme. It is a collaborative Copernicus mission, implemented and co-funded by the European Commission, ESA, EUMETSAT and the USA, through NASA and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)."

#> [1] "The Sentinel-6 SAFE format wraps a folder containing a collection of measurement and annotation data in binary files (netCDF4 or raw binary based) and product metadata in XML. It is a Sentinel-6 specific variation of the Standard Archive Format for Europe (SAFE). This is sent in a compressed Submission Information Package (SIP)."

AMR-C Level 2 Products as generated by the AMR-C CFI Processor. These products include antenna and brightness temperatures, wet tropospheric correction, water vapour content, and a rain flag. Sentinel-6 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme. It is a collaborative Copernicus mission, implemented and co-funded by the European Commission, ESA, EUMETSAT and the USA, through NASA and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA). http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode Released European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT for Copernicus +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode originator originator https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/S6_LR.jpg Brightness Temperature Level 2 Data disableCustomizeCart http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_KeywordTypeCode theme - http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_CoverageContentTypeCode image European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode distributor distributor https://data.eumetsat.int/data/map/EO:EUM:DAT:0241 https Download CI_OnLineFunctionCode order Download SENTINEL-SAFE - S6A_MW_2__AMR_____20211115T013203_20211115T022816_20211116T085225_3373_037_140_070_EUM__REP_NT_F06.SEN6.zip MB 1 25 (per day) The Sentinel-6 SAFE format wraps a folder containing a collection of measurement and annotation data in binary files (netCDF4 or raw binary based) and product metadata in XML. It is a Sentinel-6 specific variation of the Standard Archive Format for Europe (SAFE). This is sent in a compressed Submission Information Package (SIP). https://www.eumetsat.int/formats#SENTINEL-SAFE SENTINEL-SAFE documentation and tools https://www.eumetsat.int/formats#SIP SIP documentation and tools https://www.eumetsat.int/formats#netCDF netCDF documentation and tools GB 15 true http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode series - Sentinel-6 Sentinel-6 AMR-C 2008-06-01 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_DateTypeCode creation AMR-C z343aaa z343aaa http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#CI_SensorTypeCode Microwave Radiometer http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OrbitTypeCode LEO degree 0"

#> $hits$hits[[7]]$`_source`
#> $hits$hits[[7]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "This is a reprocessed dataset at baseline F06, which is continued by the NRT/NTC data stream from 29/April/2022 onwards.\r\n\r\nThe Level-1B LR product is output of the LR processor. It includes geo-located, and fully calibrated pulse-limited low-resolution Ku-band and C-band waveforms.\r\n\r\nThis product is most relevant to geophysical retrieval algorithm developers (over ocean, land and ice surfaces), surface characterisations studies (e.g. impact of sea state bias, wave directional effects etc) and Quality Control systems.\r\n\r\nSentinel-6 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme. It is a collaborative Copernicus mission, implemented and co-funded by the European Commission, ESA, EUMETSAT and the USA, through NASA and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)."
#>

#> $hits$hits[[7]]$`_source`$file_format_description
#> [1] "The Sentinel-6 SAFE format wraps a folder containing a collection of measurement and annotation data in binary files (netCDF4 or raw binary based) and product metadata in XML. It is a Sentinel-6 specific variation of the Standard Archive Format for Europe (SAFE). This is sent in a compressed Submission Information Package (SIP)."

Sentinel-6 - Reprocessed P4_1B_LR_F06 2022-07-28 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_DateTypeCode creation F06 EO:EUM:DAT:0237 10.15770/EUM_SEC_CLM_0078 http://datacite.org EUMETSAT for Copernicus http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode authorDetails http://doi.org/10.15770/EUM_SEC_CLM_0078 Digital Object Identifier (DOI): 10.15770/EUM_SEC_CLM_0078 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author https://www.eumetsat.int/sentinel-6 Sentinel-6 web pages http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author https://eumetsatspace.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SEN6/overview Sentinel-6 knowledge base http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author https://www.eumetsat.int/altimetry-resources Altimetry resources http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author This is a reprocessed dataset at baseline F06, which is continued by the NRT/NTC data stream from 29/April/2022 onwards. The Level-1B LR product is output of the LR processor. It includes geo-located, and fully calibrated pulse-limited low-resolution Ku-band and C-band waveforms. This product is most relevant to geophysical retrieval algorithm developers (over ocean, land and ice surfaces), surface characterisations studies (e.g. impact of sea state bias, wave directional effects etc) and Quality Control systems. Sentinel-6 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme. It is a collaborative Copernicus mission, implemented and co-funded by the European Commission, ESA, EUMETSAT and the USA, through NASA and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA). http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode Released European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT for Copernicus +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode originator originator https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/S6_LR.jpg Level 1 Data Ocean Ocean Surface Wind Sea Surface Height Wave Wind disableCustomizeCart http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_KeywordTypeCode theme - It is a Sentinel-6 specific variation of the Standard Archive Format for Europe (SAFE). This is sent in a compressed Submission Information Package (SIP). https://www.eumetsat.int/formats#SENTINEL-SAFE SENTINEL-SAFE documentation and tools https://www.eumetsat.int/formats#netCDF netCDF documentation and tools https://www.eumetsat.int/formats#SIP SIP documentation and tools GB 980 true http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode series - Sentinel-6 Sentinel-6 Poseidon-4 2008-06-01 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_DateTypeCode creation Poseidon-4 z341aaa z341aaa http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#CI_SensorTypeCode Altimetric http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OrbitTypeCode LEO"

codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty></gmd:CI_Citation></gmd:citation><gmd:abstract><gco:CharacterString>This is a reprocessed dataset at baseline F06, which is continued by the NRT/NTC data stream from 29/April/2022 onwards.&#xD;\n&#xD;\nThe Level-1B LR product is output of the LR processor. It includes geo-located, and fully calibrated pulse-limited low-resolution Ku-band and C-band waveforms.&#xD;\n&#xD;\nThis product is most relevant to geophysical retrieval algorithm developers (over ocean, land and ice surfaces), surface characterisations studies (e.g. impact of sea state bias, wave directional effects etc) and Quality Control systems.&#xD;\n&#xD;\nSentinel-6 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme. It is a collaborative Copernicus mission, implemented and co-funded by the European Commission, ESA, EUMETSAT and the USA, through NASA and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA).</gco:CharacterString></gmd:abstract><gmd:status><gmd:MD_ProgressCode codeList=\"http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode\" #> [1] "{\"@context\":\"http://schema.org/\",\"@type\":\"Dataset\",\"url\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/product/EO:EUM:DAT:0237\",\"measurementTechnique\":\"Altimetric\",\"copyrightHolder\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT for Copernicus\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"copyrightYear\":\"2020\",\"creator\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT for Copernicus\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"dateCreated\":\"Fri Jan 17 00:12:00 GMT 2020\",\"isAccessibleForFree\":\"false\",\"keywords\":\"Wave,Wind,Altimetric,Sentinel-6,SENTINEL-SAFE,Sea Surface Height,LEO,Ocean Surface Wind,Ocean,Poseidon-4,Level 1 Data\",\"license\":\"https://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/terms.faces\",\"publisher\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT for Copernicus\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"schemaVersion\":\"3.5\",\"spatialCoverage\":{\"@type\":\"Place\",\"geo\":{\"@type\":\"GeoShape\",\"polygon\":\"-180.0  66.15  180.0  -66.15\"}},\"temporalCoverage\":\"Fri Jan 17 00:12:00 GMT 2020 / Fri Jan 28 00:04:00 GMT 2022\",\"thumbnailUrl\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/S6_LR.jpg\",\"encodingFormat\":\"SENTINEL-SAFE\",\"description\":\"This is a reprocessed dataset at baseline F06, which is continued by the NRT/NTC data stream from 29/April/2022 onwards.\\r\\n\\r\\nThe Level-1B LR product is output of the LR processor. It includes geo-located, and fully calibrated pulse-limited low-resolution Ku-band and C-band waveforms.\\r\\n\\r\\nThis product is most relevant to geophysical retrieval algorithm developers (over ocean, land and ice surfaces), surface characterisations studies (e.g. impact of sea state bias, wave directional effects etc) and Quality Control systems.\\r\\n\\r\\nSentinel-6 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme. It is a collaborative Copernicus mission, implemented and co-funded by the European Commission, ESA, EUMETSAT and the USA, through NASA and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA).\",\"identifier\":\"EO:EUM:DAT:0237\",\"name\":\"Poseidon-4 Altimetry Level 1B Low Resolution (baseline version F06) - Sentinel-6 - Reprocessed\"}"

#> [1] 1
#> 
#> $hits$hits[[8]]$`_source`
#> $hits$hits[[8]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "SRAL Level 1B: Complex echoes (In-phase (I) and Quadrature (Q)) for the Low Resolution Mode (LRM) and/or Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) mode both for C Band and Ku band. When the altimeter is in SAR mode, this product also contains the so-called Pseudo LRM (PLRM) echoes. Sentinel-3 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme.\r\n\r\nThis collection contains reprocessed data from baseline collection 004. Operational data can be found in the corresponding collection."

#> $hits$hits[[8]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$fileFormatDescription
#> [1] "The Sentinel-3 SAFE format wraps a folder containing a collection of measurement and annotation data in binary files (netCDF4 or raw binary based) and product metadata in XML. It is a Sentinel-3 specific variation of the Standard Archive Format for Europe (SAFE). This is sent in a compressed Submission Information Package (SIP)."

the Low Resolution Mode (LRM) and/or Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) mode both for C Band and Ku band. When the altimeter is in SAR mode, this product also contains the so-called Pseudo LRM (PLRM) echoes. Sentinel-3 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme. This collection contains reprocessed data from baseline collection 004. codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty></gmd:CI_Citation></gmd:citation><gmd:abstract><gco:CharacterString>SRAL Level 1B: Complex echoes (In-phase (I) and Quadrature (Q)) for the Low Resolution Mode (LRM) and/or Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) mode both for C Band and Ku band. When the altimeter is in SAR mode, this product also contains the so-called Pseudo LRM (PLRM) echoes. Sentinel-3 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme.&#xD;\n&#xD;\nThis collection contains reprocessed data from baseline collection 004. Operational data can be found in the corresponding collection.</gco:CharacterString></gmd:abstract><gmd:status><gmd:MD_ProgressCode #> $hits$hits[[9]]$`_source`
#> $hits$hits[[9]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "The High Resolution Infrared Sounder (HIRS) operates at 20 channels (19 channels in the infrared and one in the visible). Its main purpose is to provide input for the vertical temperature and humidity profile retrievals. In addition, the HIRS pixel resolution serves as the standard grid resolution for all ATOVS level 2 products.\r\n\r\nMetop-A data are available in the Data Centre up to 15/11/2021."

Its main purpose is to provide input for the vertical temperature and humidity profile retrievals. In addition, the HIRS pixel resolution serves as the standard grid resolution for all ATOVS level 2 products. Metop-A data are available in the Data Centre up to 15/11/2021. http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode Discontinued European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode originator originator https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/hirs.jpg Atmosphere Level 1 Data http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_KeywordTypeCode theme - (HIRS) operates at 20 channels (19 channels in the infrared and one in the visible). #> 
#> $hits$hits[[10]]$`_source`
#> $hits$hits[[10]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "Rectified (level 1.5) Meteosat SEVIRI image data. The data is transmitted as High Rate transmissions in 12 spectral channels. Level 1.5 image data corresponds to the geolocated and radiometrically pre-processed image data, ready for further processing, e.g. the extraction of meteorological products. Any spacecraft specific effects have been removed, and in particular, linearisation and equalisation of the image radiometry has been performed for all SEVIRI channels. The on-board blackbody data has been processed. Both radiometric and geometric quality control information is included."
#>

#> $hits$hits[[10]]$`_source`$fulltext
#> [1] "EO:EUM:DAT:0160 http://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/IG/ert/iso639.htm eng http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode series theme.par.Atmosphere theme.par.Land theme.par.Level_1_Data theme.par.Ocean dis.View sat.MSG view.Satellite.MSG 0DEG.Channels view.Theme.Atmospheric Composition European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode pointOfContact pointOfContact 2020-03-11 ISO19115 2003/Cor.1:2006 High Rate SEVIRI WV6.2 μm Image - MSG - 0 degree HRSEVIRI MSG15 2009-03-23 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_DateTypeCode creation 2010-09-21 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_DateTypeCode revision EO:EUM:DAT:0160 https://www.eumetsat.int/media/45126 MSG Level 1.5 Image Data Format Description http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author Rectified (level 1.5) Meteosat SEVIRI image data. The data is transmitted as High Rate transmissions in 12 spectral channels. Level 1.5 image data corresponds to the geolocated and radiometrically pre-processed image data, ready for further processing, e.g. the extraction of meteorological products. Any spacecraft specific effects have been removed, and in particular, linearisation and equalisation of the image radiometry has been performed for all SEVIRI channels. The on-board blackbody data has been processed. Both radiometric and geometric quality control information is included. http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode Operational European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode originator originator https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/msg-level-1-5.jpg Atmosphere Land Level 1 Data Ocean http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_KeywordTypeCode theme http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ClassificationCode restricted - codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode\" codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty></gmd:CI_Citation></gmd:citation><gmd:abstract><gco:CharacterString>Rectified (level 1.5) Meteosat SEVIRI image data. The data is transmitted as High Rate transmissions in 12 spectral channels. Level 1.5 image data corresponds to the geolocated and radiometrically pre-processed image data, ready for further processing, e.g. the extraction of meteorological products. Any spacecraft specific effects have been removed, and in particular, linearisation and equalisation of the image radiometry has been performed for all SEVIRI channels. The on-board blackbody data has been processed. Both radiometric and geometric quality control information is included.</gco:CharacterString></gmd:abstract><gmd:status><gmd:MD_ProgressCode codeList=\"http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode\" The data is transmitted as High Rate transmissions in 12 spectral channels. Level 1.5 image data corresponds to the geolocated and radiometrically pre-processed image data, ready for further processing, e.g. the extraction of meteorological products. Any spacecraft specific effects have been removed, and in particular, linearisation and equalisation of the image radiometry has been performed for all SEVIRI channels. The on-board blackbody data has been processed. Both radiometric and geometric quality control information is included.\",\"identifier\":\"EO:EUM:DAT:0160\",\"name\":\"High Rate SEVIRI WV6.2 μm Image - MSG - 0 degree \"}"

#> [[1]]
#> [[1]]$`_index`
#> [1] "csw"
#> 
#> [[1]]$`_type`
#> [1] "record"
#> 
#> [[1]]$`_id`
#> [1] "EO:EUM:DAT:0082"
#> 
#> [[1]]$`_score`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> [[1]]$`_source`
#> [[1]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "Release 1 of the Fundamental Climate Data Record (FCDR) of the Meteosat Visible and Infrared Imager (MVIRI) onboard the Meteosat First Generation (MFG)  provides georectified, recalibrated, and consolidated Level 1.5 data of the visible (VIS), infrared (IR) and water vapor (WV) bands along with all metadata, spectral response functions (reconstructed for the VIS channel), as well as calibration information to compute radiance, brightness temperature and reflectance. The VIS band data are provided along with detailed measurement uncertainties and error correlation information. As further elaborated in the Product User Guide, the files are provided in FIDUCEO EASY and FULL (only available on special request) netCDF4 formats.\r\n\r\nRelease 1 of the MVIRI FCDR consists of data from the Meteosat-5 satellite with nominal sub-satellite longitude 63 degrees. Release 1 was produced as part of the FP7 ERA-CLIM2 and H2020 FIDUCEO project."
#>

John, Roebeling, Rob, Hewison, Tim, and Schulz, Jörg 2019: Recalibration of over 35 Years of Infrared and Water Vapor Channel Radiances of the JMA Geostationary Satellites, Remote Sens.2019,11, 1189; doi:10.3390/rs11101189 http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode isCitedBy http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author https://doi.org/10.5194/amt-13-1167-2020 Liefhebber, F., Lammens, S., Brussee, P. W. G., Bos, A., John, V. O., Rüthrich, F., Onderwaater, J., Grant, M. G., and Schulz, J. (2020) Automatic quality control of the Meteosat First Generation measurements, Atmos. Meas. Tech., 13, 1167–1179, https://doi.org/10.5194/amt-13-1167-2020. http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode isCitedBy http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author Release 1 of the Fundamental Climate Data Record (FCDR) of the Meteosat Visible and Infrared Imager (MVIRI) onboard the Meteosat First Generation (MFG) provides georectified, recalibrated, and consolidated Level 1.5 data of the visible (VIS), infrared (IR) and water vapor (WV) bands along with all metadata, spectral response functions (reconstructed for the VIS channel), as well as calibration information to compute radiance, brightness temperature and reflectance. The VIS band data are provided along with detailed measurement uncertainties and error correlation information. As further elaborated in the Product User Guide, the files are provided in FIDUCEO EASY and FULL (only available on special request) netCDF4 formats. Release 1 of the MVIRI FCDR consists of data from the Meteosat-5 satellite with nominal sub-satellite longitude 63 degrees. Release 1 was produced as part of the FP7 ERA-CLIM2 and H2020 FIDUCEO project. http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode Released European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode originator originator https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/MET7FCDR_63degree.png Brightness Temperature Climate Fundamental Climate Data Record Level 1 Data http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_KeywordTypeCode theme - W. G., Bos, A., John, V. O., Rüthrich, F., Onderwaater, J., Grant, M. G., and Schulz, J. (2020) Automatic quality control of the Meteosat First Generation measurements, Atmos. Meas. Tech., 13, 1167–1179, https://doi.org/10.5194/amt-13-1167-2020.</gco:CharacterString></gmd:name><gmd:function><gmd:CI_OnLineFunctionCode codeList=\"http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode\" codeListValue=\"isCitedBy\"/></gmd:function></gmd:CI_OnlineResource></gmd:onlineResource></gmd:CI_Contact></gmd:contactInfo><gmd:role><gmd:CI_RoleCode codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode\" codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty></gmd:CI_Citation></gmd:citation><gmd:abstract><gco:CharacterString>Release 1 of the Fundamental Climate Data Record (FCDR) of the Meteosat Visible and Infrared Imager (MVIRI) onboard the Meteosat First Generation (MFG)  provides georectified, recalibrated, and consolidated Level 1.5 data of the visible (VIS), infrared (IR) and water vapor (WV) bands along with all metadata, spectral response functions (reconstructed for the VIS channel), as well as calibration information to compute radiance, brightness temperature and reflectance. The VIS band data are provided along with detailed measurement uncertainties and error correlation information. As further elaborated in the Product User Guide, the files are provided in FIDUCEO EASY and FULL (only available on special request) netCDF4 formats.&#xD;\n&#xD;\nRelease 1 of the MVIRI FCDR consists of data from the Meteosat-5 satellite with nominal sub-satellite longitude 63 degrees. Release 1 was produced as part of the FP7 ERA-CLIM2 and H2020 FIDUCEO project.</gco:CharacterString></gmd:abstract><gmd:status><gmd:MD_ProgressCode GMT 1998\",\"isAccessibleForFree\":\"false\",\"keywords\":\"GEO,Climate,MVIRI,netCDF4,Optical,Meteosat First Generation (MFG),Fundamental Climate Data Record,Brightness Temperature,Level 1 Data,MFG\",\"license\":\"https://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/terms.faces\",\"publisher\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"schemaVersion\":\"3.5\",\"spatialCoverage\":{\"@type\":\"Place\",\"geo\":{\"@type\":\"GeoShape\",\"polygon\":\"-18.15  81.08  144.15  -81.08\"}},\"temporalCoverage\":\"Wed Jan 14 00:05:00 GMT 1998 / Tue Jan 31 00:12:00 GMT 2006\",\"thumbnailUrl\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/MET7FCDR_63degree.png\",\"encodingFormat\":\"netCDF4\",\"description\":\"Release 1 of the Fundamental Climate Data Record (FCDR) of the Meteosat Visible and Infrared Imager (MVIRI) onboard the Meteosat First Generation (MFG)  provides georectified, recalibrated, and consolidated Level 1.5 data of the visible (VIS), infrared (IR) and water vapor (WV) bands along with all metadata, spectral response functions (reconstructed for the VIS channel), as well as calibration information to compute radiance, brightness temperature and reflectance. The VIS band data are provided along with detailed measurement uncertainties and error correlation information. As further elaborated in the Product User Guide, the files are provided in FIDUCEO EASY and FULL (only available on special request) netCDF4 formats.\\r\\n\\r\\nRelease 1 of the MVIRI FCDR consists of data from the Meteosat-5 satellite with nominal sub-satellite longitude 63 degrees. Release 1 was produced as part of the FP7 ERA-CLIM2 and H2020 FIDUCEO project.\",\"identifier\":\"EO:EUM:DAT:0082\",\"name\":\"MVIRI Level 1.5 Climate Data Record Release 1 - MFG - 63 degree\"}"
#> 
#> 
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [[2]]$`_index`
#> [1] "csw"
#> 
#> [[2]]$`_type`
#> [1] "record"
#> 
#> [[2]]$`_id`
#> [1] "EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:MSG15-RSS"
#> 
#> [[2]]$`_score`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> [[2]]$`_source`
#> [[2]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "Rectified (level 1.5) Meteosat SEVIRI Rapid Scan image data. The baseline scan region is a reduced area of the top 1/3 of a nominal repeat cycle, covering a latitude range from approximately 15 degrees to 70 degrees. The service generates repeat cycles at 5-minute intervals (the same as currently used for weather radars). The dissemination of RSS data is similar to the normal dissemination, with image segments based on 464 lines and compatible with the full disk level 1.5 data scans. Epilogue and prologue (L1.5 Header and L1.5 Trailer) have the same structure. Calibration is as in Full Earth Scan. Image rectification is to 9.5 degreesE. The scans start at 00:00, 00:05, 00:10, 00:15 ... etc. (5 min scan). The differences from the nominal Full Earth scan are that for channels 1 - 11, only segments 6 - 8 are disseminated and for the High Resolution Visible Channel only segments 16 - 24 are disseminated."
#>

#> [[2]]$`_source`$xmldoc
#> [1] "<?xml version=\"1.0\" encoding=\"UTF-8\"?><gmi:MI_Metadata xmlns=\"http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmd\" xmlns:date=\"http://exslt.org/dates-and-times\" xmlns:eum=\"http://www.eumetsat.int/2008/gmi\" xmlns:fn=\"http://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-functions\" xmlns:gco=\"http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gco\" xmlns:gmd=\"http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmd\" xmlns:gmi=\"http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmi\" xmlns:gml=\"http://www.opengis.net/gml\" xmlns:gmx=\"http://www.isotc211.org/2005/gmx\" xmlns:str=\"http://exslt.org/strings\" xmlns:xdt=\"http://www.w3.org/2005/02/xpath-datatypes\" xmlns:xlink=\"http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink\" xmlns:xs=\"http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema\" xmlns:xsi=\"http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance\" xsi:schemaLocation=\"http://www.eumetsat.int/2008/gmi http://navigator.eumetsat.int/discovery/rest/schemas/eum/eum.xsd\"><gmd:fileIdentifier><gco:CharacterString>EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:MSG15-RSS</gco:CharacterString></gmd:fileIdentifier><gmd:language><LanguageCode Level 1.5 Image Data Format Description</gco:CharacterString></gmd:name><gmd:function><gmd:CI_OnLineFunctionCode codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode\" codeListValue=\"information\"/></gmd:function></gmd:CI_OnlineResource></gmd:onlineResource></gmd:CI_Contact></gmd:contactInfo><gmd:role><gmd:CI_RoleCode codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode\" codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty></gmd:CI_Citation></gmd:citation><gmd:abstract><gco:CharacterString>Rectified (level 1.5) Meteosat SEVIRI Rapid Scan image data. The baseline scan region is a reduced area of the top 1/3 of a nominal repeat cycle, covering a latitude range from approximately 15 degrees to 70 degrees. The service generates repeat cycles at 5-minute intervals (the same as currently used for weather radars). The dissemination of RSS data is similar to the normal dissemination, with image segments based on 464 lines and compatible with the full disk level 1.5 data scans. Epilogue and prologue (L1.5 Header and L1.5 Trailer) have the same structure. Calibration is as in Full Earth Scan. Image rectification is to 9.5 degreesE. The scans start at 00:00, 00:05, 00:10, 00:15 ... etc. (5 min scan). The differences from the nominal Full Earth scan are that for channels 1 - 11, only segments 6 - 8 are disseminated and for the High Resolution Visible Channel only segments 16 - 24 are disseminated.</gco:CharacterString></gmd:abstract><gmd:status><gmd:MD_ProgressCode codeList=\"http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode\" #> [[2]]$`_source`$schemaOrgDefinition
#> [1] "{\"@context\":\"http://schema.org/\",\"@type\":\"Dataset\",\"url\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/product/EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:MSG15-RSS\",\"measurementTechnique\":\"Optical\",\"copyrightHolder\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"copyrightYear\":\"2008\",\"creator\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"dateCreated\":\"Sun Jan 13 00:05:00 GMT 2008\",\"dateModified\":\"Tue Jan 26 00:11:00 GMT 2010\",\"isAccessibleForFree\":\"false\",\"keywords\":\"GEO,MSG,Native,Meteosat Second Generation (MSG),Atmosphere,Optical,Ocean,SEVIRI,Level 1 Data,Land\",\"license\":\"https://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/terms.faces\",\"publisher\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"schemaVersion\":\"3.5\",\"spatialCoverage\":{\"@type\":\"Place\",\"geo\":{\"@type\":\"GeoShape\",\"polygon\":\"-65.0  70.0  84.0  16.0\"}},\"temporalCoverage\":\"Sun Jan 13 00:05:00 GMT 2008 / Wed Mar 16 11:47:43 GMT 2022\",\"thumbnailUrl\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/img_msg_rss_onethird_scan.jpg\",\"encodingFormat\":\"Native\",\"description\":\"Rectified (level 1.5) Meteosat SEVIRI Rapid Scan image data. The baseline scan region is a reduced area of the top 1/3 of a nominal repeat cycle, covering a latitude range from approximately 15 degrees to 70 degrees. The service generates repeat cycles at 5-minute intervals (the same as currently used for weather radars). The dissemination of RSS data is similar to the normal dissemination, with image segments based on 464 lines and compatible with the full disk level 1.5 data scans. Epilogue and prologue (L1.5 Header and L1.5 Trailer) have the same structure. Calibration is as in Full Earth Scan. Image rectification is to 9.5 degreesE. The scans start at 00:00, 00:05, 00:10, 00:15 ... etc. (5 min scan). The differences from the nominal Full Earth scan are that for channels 1 - 11, only segments 6 - 8 are disseminated and for the High Resolution Visible Channel only segments 16 - 24 are disseminated.\",\"identifier\":\"EO:EUM:DAT:MSG:MSG15-RSS\",\"name\":\"Rapid Scan High Rate SEVIRI Level 1.5 Image Data - MSG\"}"
#>

#> [[3]]$`_score`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> [[3]]$`_source`
#> [[3]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "SLSTR SST has a spatial resolution of 1km at nadir. Skin Sea Surface Temperature following the GHRSST L2P GDS2 format specification, see https://www.ghrsst.org/ . \r\n\r\n- All Sentinel-3 NRT products are available at pick-up point in less than 3h\r\n- All Sentinel-3 Non Time Critical (NTC) products are available at pick-up point in less than 30 days.\r\nSentinel-3 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme."

#> [[3]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$fileFormatDescription
#> [1] "The Sentinel-3 SAFE format wraps a folder containing a collection of measurement and annotation data in binary files (netCDF4 or raw binary based) and product metadata in XML. It is a Sentinel-3 specific variation of the Standard Archive Format for Europe (SAFE). This is sent in a compressed Submission Information Package (SIP)."

#> [1] "The Sentinel-3 SAFE format wraps a folder containing a collection of measurement and annotation data in binary files (netCDF4 or raw binary based) and product metadata in XML. It is a Sentinel-3 specific variation of the Standard Archive Format for Europe (SAFE). This is sent in a compressed Submission Information Package (SIP)."

Skin Sea Surface Temperature following the GHRSST L2P GDS2 format specification, see https://www.ghrsst.org/ . &#xD;\n&#xD;\n- All Sentinel-3 NRT products are available at pick-up point in less than 3h&#xD;\n- All Sentinel-3 Non Time Critical (NTC) products are available at pick-up point in less than 30 days.&#xD;\nSentinel-3 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the folder containing a collection of measurement and annotation data in binary files (netCDF4 or raw binary based) and product metadata in XML. It is a Sentinel-3 specific variation of the Standard Archive Format for Europe (SAFE). #> [1] "{\"@context\":\"http://schema.org/\",\"@type\":\"Dataset\",\"url\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/product/EO:EUM:DAT:0412\",\"measurementTechnique\":\"Optical\",\"copyrightHolder\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT for Copernicus\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"copyrightYear\":\"2017\",\"creator\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT for Copernicus\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"dateCreated\":\"Thu Jan 05 00:07:00 GMT 2017\",\"isAccessibleForFree\":\"false\",\"keywords\":\"Sentinel-3,SENTINEL-SAFE,Optical,LEO,Ocean,Sea Surface Temperature,Level 2 Data,SLSTR\",\"license\":\"https://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/terms.faces\",\"publisher\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT for Copernicus\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"schemaVersion\":\"3.5\",\"spatialCoverage\":{\"@type\":\"Place\",\"geo\":{\"@type\":\"GeoShape\",\"polygon\":\"-180.0  90.0  180.0  -90.0\"}},\"temporalCoverage\":\"Thu Jan 05 00:07:00 GMT 2017 / Wed Jun 08 19:33:23 GMT 2022\",\"thumbnailUrl\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/20170617_sst_slstra_mar-l2p-v1.0__daytime_nrt_ref.png\",\"encodingFormat\":\"SENTINEL-SAFE\",\"description\":\"SLSTR SST has a spatial resolution of 1km at nadir. Skin Sea Surface Temperature following the GHRSST L2P GDS2 format specification, see https://www.ghrsst.org/ . \\r\\n\\r\\n- All Sentinel-3 NRT products are available at pick-up point in less than 3h\\r\\n- All Sentinel-3 Non Time Critical (NTC) products are available at pick-up point in less than 30 days.\\r\\nSentinel-3 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme.\",\"identifier\":\"EO:EUM:DAT:0412\",\"name\":\"SLSTR Level 2 Sea Surface Temperature (SST) - Sentinel-3\"}"
#>

#> [[4]]
#> [[4]]$`_index`
#> [1] "csw"
#> 
#> [[4]]$`_type`
#> [1] "record"
#> 
#> [[4]]$`_id`
#> [1] "EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:ASCSZR1B"
#> 
#> [[4]]$`_score`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> [[4]]$`_source`
#> [[4]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "The prime objective of the Advanced SCATterometer (ASCAT) is to measure wind speed and direction over the oceans, and the main operational application is the assimilation of ocean winds in NWP models. Other operational applications, based on the use of measurements of the backscattering coefficient, are sea ice edge detection and monitoring, monitoring sea ice, snow cover, soil moisture and surface parameters. The product is available from the archive in 2 different spatial resolutions; 25 km and 12.5 km. Note that some of the data are reprocessed. Please refer to the associated product validation reports or product release notes for further information. Near real-time distribution discontinued on 29/09/2015 but the product contents are now available in the corresponding Level 2 product 'ASCAT Soil Moisture at 12.5 km Swath Grid'.\r\n\r\nMetop-A data are available in the Data Centre up to 15/11/2021."
#>
