of ASCAT-Normalised Radar Cross Section: ATBD</gco:CharacterString></gmd:name><gmd:function><gmd:CI_OnLineFunctionCode codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode\" codeListValue=\"information\"/></gmd:function></gmd:CI_OnlineResource></gmd:onlineResource></gmd:CI_Contact></gmd:contactInfo><gmd:role><gmd:CI_RoleCode codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode\" codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty></gmd:CI_Citation></gmd:citation><gmd:abstract><gco:CharacterString>The prime objective of the Advanced SCATterometer (ASCAT) is to measure wind speed and direction over the oceans, and the main operational application is the assimilation of ocean winds in NWP models. Other operational applications, based on the use of measurements of the backscattering coefficient, are sea ice edge detection and monitoring, monitoring sea ice, snow cover, soil moisture and surface parameters. The product is available from the archive in 2 different spatial resolutions; 25 km and 12.5 km. Note that some of the data are reprocessed. Please refer to the associated product validation reports or product release notes for further information. Near real-time distribution discontinued on 29/09/2015 but the product contents are now available in the corresponding Level 2 product 'ASCAT Soil Moisture at 12.5 km Swath Grid'.&#xD;\n&#xD;\nMetop-A data are available in the Data Centre up to 15/11/2021.</gco:CharacterString></gmd:abstract><gmd:status><gmd:MD_ProgressCode codeList=\"http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode\" #> [1] "{\"@context\":\"http://schema.org/\",\"@type\":\"Dataset\",\"url\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/product/EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:ASCSZR1B\",\"measurementTechnique\":\"Scatterometer\",\"copyrightHolder\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"copyrightYear\":\"2007\",\"creator\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"dateCreated\":\"Mon Jan 01 00:03:00 GMT 2007\",\"dateModified\":\"Thu Jan 21 00:09:00 GMT 2010\",\"isAccessibleForFree\":\"false\",\"keywords\":\"Native,Metop,LEO,Ocean,Radar Backscatter NRCS,Level 1 Data,Scatterometer,ASCAT,Land\",\"license\":\"https://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/terms.faces\",\"publisher\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"schemaVersion\":\"3.5\",\"spatialCoverage\":{\"@type\":\"Place\",\"geo\":{\"@type\":\"GeoShape\",\"polygon\":\"-180.0  90.0  180.0  -90.0\"}},\"temporalCoverage\":\"Mon Jan 01 00:03:00 GMT 2007 / Thu May 26 08:20:33 GMT 2022\",\"encodingFormat\":\"Native\",\"description\":\"The prime objective of the Advanced SCATterometer (ASCAT) is to measure wind speed and direction over the oceans, and the main operational application is the assimilation of ocean winds in NWP models. Other operational applications, based on the use of measurements of the backscattering coefficient, are sea ice edge detection and monitoring, monitoring sea ice, snow cover, soil moisture and surface parameters. The product is available from the archive in 2 different spatial resolutions; 25 km and 12.5 km. Note that some of the data are reprocessed. Please refer to the associated product validation reports or product release notes for further information. Near real-time distribution discontinued on 29/09/2015 but the product contents are now available in the corresponding Level 2 product 'ASCAT Soil Moisture at 12.5 km Swath Grid'.\\r\\n\\r\\nMetop-A data are available in the Data Centre up to 15/11/2021.\",\"identifier\":\"EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:ASCSZR1B\",\"name\":\"ASCAT Level 1 Sigma0 resampled at 12.5 km Swath Grid - Metop - Global\"}"
#>

#> 
#> [[5]]
#> [[5]]$`_index`
#> [1] "csw"
#> 
#> [[5]]$`_type`
#> [1] "record"
#> 
#> [[5]]$`_id`
#> [1] "EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:ASCSZF1B"
#> 
#> [[5]]$`_score`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> [[5]]$`_source`
#> [[5]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "The prime objective of the Advanced SCATterometer (ASCAT) is to measure wind speed and direction over the oceans, and the main operational application is the assimilation of ocean winds in NWP models. Other operational applications, based on the use of measurements of the backscattering coefficient, are sea ice edge detection and monitoring, monitoring sea ice, snow cover, soil moisture and surface parameters. This product consists of geo-located radar backscatter values along the six ASCAT beams. The different beam measurements are not collocated into a regular swath grid and the individual measurements are not spatially averaged. The resolution of each of the 255 backscatter values per each beam varies slightly along the beam, but it is approximately 10km (in the along beam direction) x 25 km (across the beam). This product is usually referred to as 'ASCAT Level 1B Full resolution product'. Note that some of the data are reprocessed. Please refer to the associated product validation reports or product release notes for further information.\r\n\r\n\r\nMetop-A data are available in the Data Centre up to 15/11/2021."

The different beam measurements are not collocated into a regular swath grid and the individual measurements are not spatially averaged. The resolution of each of the 255 backscatter values per each beam varies slightly along the beam, but it is approximately 10km (in the along beam direction) x 25 km (across the beam). Please refer to the associated product validation reports or product release notes for further information. Reprocessing Phase 1 - Validation Report</gco:CharacterString></gmd:name><gmd:function><gmd:CI_OnLineFunctionCode codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode\" codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode\" codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty><gmd:citedResponsibleParty><gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty><gmd:contactInfo><gmd:CI_Contact><gmd:onlineResource><gmd:CI_OnlineResource><gmd:linkage><gmd:URL>https://www.eumetsat.int/media/37421</gmd:URL></gmd:linkage><gmd:name><gco:CharacterString>Estimation of ASCAT-Normalised Radar Cross Section: ATBD</gco:CharacterString></gmd:name><gmd:function><gmd:CI_OnLineFunctionCode codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode\" codeListValue=\"information\"/></gmd:function></gmd:CI_OnlineResource></gmd:onlineResource></gmd:CI_Contact></gmd:contactInfo><gmd:role><gmd:CI_RoleCode codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode\" codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty></gmd:CI_Citation></gmd:citation><gmd:abstract><gco:CharacterString>The prime objective of the Advanced SCATterometer (ASCAT) is to measure wind speed and direction over the oceans, and the main operational application is the assimilation of ocean winds in NWP models. Other operational applications, based on the use of measurements of the backscattering coefficient, are sea ice edge detection and monitoring, monitoring sea ice, snow cover, soil moisture and surface parameters. This product consists of geo-located radar backscatter values along the six ASCAT beams. The different beam measurements are not collocated into a regular swath grid and the individual measurements are not spatially averaged. The resolution of each of the 255 backscatter values per each beam varies slightly along the beam, but it is approximately 10km (in the along beam direction) x 25 km (across the beam). This product is usually referred to as 'ASCAT Level 1B Full resolution product'. Note that some of the data are reprocessed. Please refer to the associated product validation reports or product release notes for further information.&#xD;\n&#xD;\n&#xD;\nMetop-A data are available in the Data Centre up to 15/11/2021.</gco:CharacterString></gmd:abstract><gmd:status><gmd:MD_ProgressCode codeList=\"http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode\" codeListValue=\"Operational\"/></gmd:status><gmd:pointOfContact><gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty><gmd:individualName><gco:CharacterString>European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Other operational applications, based on the use of measurements of the backscattering coefficient, are sea ice edge detection and monitoring, monitoring sea ice, snow cover, soil moisture and surface parameters. This product consists of geo-located radar backscatter values along the six ASCAT beams. The different beam measurements are not collocated into a regular swath grid and the individual measurements are not spatially averaged. The resolution of each of the 255 backscatter values per each beam varies slightly along the beam, but it is approximately 10km (in the along beam direction) x 25 km (across the beam). This product is usually referred to as 'ASCAT Level 1B Full resolution product'. Note that some of the data are reprocessed. Please refer to the associated product validation reports or product release notes for further information.\\r\\n\\r\\n\\r\\nMetop-A data are available in the Data Centre up to 15/11/2021.\",\"identifier\":\"EO:EUM:DAT:METOP:ASCSZF1B\",\"name\":\"ASCAT Level 1 Sigma0 Full Resolution - Metop - Global\"}"

#> [[6]]$`_source`
#> [[6]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "This is a reprocessed dataset at baseline F06, which is continued by the NRT/NTC data stream from 29/April/2022 onwards.\r\n\r\nAMR-C Level 2 Products as generated by the AMR-C CFI Processor.\r\n\r\nThese products include antenna and brightness temperatures, wet tropospheric correction, water vapour content, and a rain flag. \r\n\r\nSentinel-6 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme. It is a collaborative Copernicus mission, implemented and co-funded by the European Commission, ESA, EUMETSAT and the USA, through NASA and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)."

#> [[6]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$fileFormatDescription
#> [1] "The Sentinel-6 SAFE format wraps a folder containing a collection of measurement and annotation data in binary files (netCDF4 or raw binary based) and product metadata in XML. It is a Sentinel-6 specific variation of the Standard Archive Format for Europe (SAFE). This is sent in a compressed Submission Information Package (SIP)."

#> [[6]]$`_source`$file_format_description
#> [1] "The Sentinel-6 SAFE format wraps a folder containing a collection of measurement and annotation data in binary files (netCDF4 or raw binary based) and product metadata in XML. It is a Sentinel-6 specific variation of the Standard Archive Format for Europe (SAFE). This is sent in a compressed Submission Information Package (SIP)."

Sentinel-6 - Reprocessed MW_2__AMR_F06 2022-07-28 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_DateTypeCode creation F06 EO:EUM:DAT:0241 10.15770/EUM_SEC_CLM_0082 http://datacite.org EUMETSAT for Copernicus http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode authorDetails http://doi.org/10.15770/EUM_SEC_CLM_0082 Digital Object Identifier (DOI): 10.15770/EUM_SEC_CLM_0082 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author https://www.eumetsat.int/sentinel-6 Sentinel-6 web pages http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author https://eumetsatspace.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SEN6/overview Sentinel-6 knowledge base http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author https://www.eumetsat.int/altimetry-resources Altimetry resources http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author This is a reprocessed dataset at baseline F06, which is continued by the NRT/NTC data stream from 29/April/2022 onwards. AMR-C Level 2 Products as generated by the AMR-C CFI Processor. These products include antenna and brightness temperatures, wet tropospheric correction, water vapour content, and a rain flag. Sentinel-6 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme. It is a collaborative Copernicus mission, implemented and co-funded by the European Commission, ESA, EUMETSAT and the USA, through NASA and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA). http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode Released European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT for Copernicus +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode originator originator https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/S6_LR.jpg Brightness Temperature Level 2 Data disableCustomizeCart http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_KeywordTypeCode theme - http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_CoverageContentTypeCode image European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode distributor distributor https://data.eumetsat.int/data/map/EO:EUM:DAT:0241 https Download CI_OnLineFunctionCode order Download SENTINEL-SAFE - S6A_MW_2__AMR_____20211115T013203_20211115T022816_20211116T085225_3373_037_140_070_EUM__REP_NT_F06.SEN6.zip MB 1 25 (per day) The Sentinel-6 SAFE format wraps a folder containing a collection of measurement and annotation data in binary files (netCDF4 or raw binary based) and product metadata in XML. It is a Sentinel-6 specific variation of the Standard Archive Format for Europe (SAFE). This is sent in a compressed Submission Information Package (SIP). https://www.eumetsat.int/formats#SENTINEL-SAFE SENTINEL-SAFE documentation and tools https://www.eumetsat.int/formats#SIP SIP documentation and tools https://www.eumetsat.int/formats#netCDF netCDF documentation and tools GB 15 true http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode series - Sentinel-6 Sentinel-6 AMR-C 2008-06-01 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_DateTypeCode creation AMR-C z343aaa z343aaa http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#CI_SensorTypeCode Microwave Radiometer http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OrbitTypeCode LEO degree 0"

#> [[7]]$`_score`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> [[7]]$`_source`
#> [[7]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "This is a reprocessed dataset at baseline F06, which is continued by the NRT/NTC data stream from 29/April/2022 onwards.\r\n\r\nThe Level-1B LR product is output of the LR processor. It includes geo-located, and fully calibrated pulse-limited low-resolution Ku-band and C-band waveforms.\r\n\r\nThis product is most relevant to geophysical retrieval algorithm developers (over ocean, land and ice surfaces), surface characterisations studies (e.g. impact of sea state bias, wave directional effects etc) and Quality Control systems.\r\n\r\nSentinel-6 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme. It is a collaborative Copernicus mission, implemented and co-funded by the European Commission, ESA, EUMETSAT and the USA, through NASA and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)."
#>

#> [1] "The Sentinel-6 SAFE format wraps a folder containing a collection of measurement and annotation data in binary files (netCDF4 or raw binary based) and product metadata in XML. It is a Sentinel-6 specific variation of the Standard Archive Format for Europe (SAFE). This is sent in a compressed Submission Information Package (SIP)."

#> [[7]]$`_source`$file_format_description
#> [1] "The Sentinel-6 SAFE format wraps a folder containing a collection of measurement and annotation data in binary files (netCDF4 or raw binary based) and product metadata in XML. It is a Sentinel-6 specific variation of the Standard Archive Format for Europe (SAFE). This is sent in a compressed Submission Information Package (SIP)."

#> [1] "EO:EUM:DAT:0237 http://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/IG/ert/iso639.htm eng http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode series theme.par.Level_1_Data theme.par.Ocean theme.par.Ocean_Surface_Wind theme.par.Sea_Surface_Height theme.par.Wave theme.par.Wind dis.Download sat.Sentinel-6 European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT for Copernicus +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode pointOfContact pointOfContact 2022-11-24 ISO19115 2003/Cor.1:2006 Poseidon-4 Altimetry Level 1B Low Resolution (baseline version F06) - Sentinel-6 - Reprocessed P4_1B_LR_F06 2022-07-28 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_DateTypeCode creation F06 EO:EUM:DAT:0237 10.15770/EUM_SEC_CLM_0078 http://datacite.org EUMETSAT for Copernicus http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode authorDetails http://doi.org/10.15770/EUM_SEC_CLM_0078 Digital Object Identifier (DOI): 10.15770/EUM_SEC_CLM_0078 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author https://www.eumetsat.int/sentinel-6 Sentinel-6 web pages http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author https://eumetsatspace.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SEN6/overview Sentinel-6 knowledge base http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author https://www.eumetsat.int/altimetry-resources Altimetry resources http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author This is a reprocessed dataset at baseline F06, which is continued by the NRT/NTC data stream from 29/April/2022 onwards. The Level-1B LR product is output of the LR processor. It includes geo-located, and fully calibrated pulse-limited low-resolution Ku-band and C-band waveforms. This product is most relevant to geophysical retrieval algorithm developers (over ocean, land and ice surfaces), surface characterisations studies (e.g. impact of sea state bias, wave directional effects etc) and Quality Control systems. Sentinel-6 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme. It is a collaborative Copernicus mission, implemented and co-funded by the European Commission, ESA, EUMETSAT and the USA, through NASA and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA). http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode Released European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT for Copernicus +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode originator originator https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/S6_LR.jpg Level 1 Data Ocean Ocean Surface Wind Sea Surface Height Wave Wind disableCustomizeCart http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_KeywordTypeCode theme - S6A_P4_1B__LR______20211026T024622_20211026T034235_20211117T132805_3373_035_137_068_EUM__REP_NT_F06.SEN6.zip MB 78 25 (per day) The Sentinel-6 SAFE format wraps a folder containing a collection of measurement and annotation data in binary files (netCDF4 or raw binary based) and product metadata in XML. It is a Sentinel-6 specific variation of the Standard Archive Format for Europe (SAFE). This is sent in a compressed Submission Information Package (SIP). https://www.eumetsat.int/formats#SENTINEL-SAFE SENTINEL-SAFE documentation and tools https://www.eumetsat.int/formats#netCDF netCDF documentation and tools https://www.eumetsat.int/formats#SIP SIP documentation and tools GB 980 true http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode series - Sentinel-6 Sentinel-6 Poseidon-4 2008-06-01 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_DateTypeCode creation Poseidon-4 z341aaa z341aaa http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#CI_SensorTypeCode Altimetric http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OrbitTypeCode LEO"

codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty></gmd:CI_Citation></gmd:citation><gmd:abstract><gco:CharacterString>This is a reprocessed dataset at baseline F06, which is continued by the NRT/NTC data stream from 29/April/2022 onwards.&#xD;\n&#xD;\nThe Level-1B LR product is output of the LR processor. It includes geo-located, and fully calibrated pulse-limited low-resolution Ku-band and C-band waveforms.&#xD;\n&#xD;\nThis product is most relevant to geophysical retrieval algorithm developers (over ocean, land and ice surfaces), surface characterisations studies (e.g. impact of sea state bias, wave directional effects etc) and Quality Control systems.&#xD;\n&#xD;\nSentinel-6 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme. It is a collaborative Copernicus mission, implemented and co-funded by the European Commission, ESA, EUMETSAT and the USA, through NASA and the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA).</gco:CharacterString></gmd:abstract><gmd:status><gmd:MD_ProgressCode codeList=\"http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode\" It includes geo-located, and fully calibrated pulse-limited low-resolution Ku-band and C-band waveforms.\\r\\n\\r\\nThis product is most relevant to geophysical retrieval algorithm developers (over ocean, land and ice surfaces), surface characterisations studies (e.g. impact of sea state bias, wave directional effects etc) and Quality Control systems.\\r\\n\\r\\nSentinel-6 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme. #> 
#> [[8]]$`_source`
#> [[8]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "SRAL Level 1B: Complex echoes (In-phase (I) and Quadrature (Q)) for the Low Resolution Mode (LRM) and/or Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) mode both for C Band and Ku band. When the altimeter is in SAR mode, this product also contains the so-called Pseudo LRM (PLRM) echoes. Sentinel-3 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme.\r\n\r\nThis collection contains reprocessed data from baseline collection 004. Operational data can be found in the corresponding collection."
#>

#> [[8]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers

#> [[8]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$format4DataCite
#> [1] "true"
#> 
#> [[8]]$`_source`$digitalTransfers$format$fileFormatDescription
#> [1] "The Sentinel-3 SAFE format wraps a folder containing a collection of measurement and annotation data in binary files (netCDF4 or raw binary based) and product metadata in XML. It is a Sentinel-3 specific variation of the Standard Archive Format for Europe (SAFE). This is sent in a compressed Submission Information Package (SIP)."

#> [1] "The Sentinel-3 SAFE format wraps a folder containing a collection of measurement and annotation data in binary files (netCDF4 or raw binary based) and product metadata in XML. It is a Sentinel-3 specific variation of the Standard Archive Format for Europe (SAFE). This is sent in a compressed Submission Information Package (SIP)."

http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author SRAL Level 1B: Complex echoes (In-phase (I) and Quadrature (Q)) for the Low Resolution Mode (LRM) and/or Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) mode both for C Band and Ku band. When the altimeter is in SAR mode, this product also contains the so-called Pseudo LRM (PLRM) echoes. Sentinel-3 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme. This collection contains reprocessed data from baseline collection 004. Operational data can be found in the corresponding collection. http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode Released European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT for Copernicus +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode originator originator https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/s3_sral.png Level 1 Data Ocean Sea Surface Height disableCustomizeCart http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_KeywordTypeCode theme - codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty></gmd:CI_Citation></gmd:citation><gmd:abstract><gco:CharacterString>SRAL Level 1B: Complex echoes (In-phase (I) and Quadrature (Q)) for the Low Resolution Mode (LRM) and/or Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) mode both for C Band and Ku band. When the altimeter is in SAR mode, this product also contains the so-called Pseudo LRM (PLRM) echoes. Sentinel-3 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme.&#xD;\n&#xD;\nThis collection contains reprocessed data from baseline collection 004. Operational data can be found in the corresponding collection.</gco:CharacterString></gmd:abstract><gmd:status><gmd:MD_ProgressCode #> [1] "{\"@context\":\"http://schema.org/\",\"@type\":\"Dataset\",\"url\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/product/EO:EUM:DAT:0584\",\"measurementTechnique\":\"Altimetric\",\"copyrightHolder\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT for Copernicus\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"copyrightYear\":\"2016\",\"creator\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT for Copernicus\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"dateCreated\":\"Fri Jan 01 00:03:00 GMT 2016\",\"isAccessibleForFree\":\"false\",\"keywords\":\"Altimetric,Sentinel-3,SENTINEL-SAFE,Sea Surface Height,LEO,Ocean,SRAL,Level 1 Data\",\"license\":\"https://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/terms.faces\",\"publisher\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT for Copernicus\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"schemaVersion\":\"3.5\",\"spatialCoverage\":{\"@type\":\"Place\",\"geo\":{\"@type\":\"GeoShape\",\"polygon\":\"-180.0  90.0  180.0  -90.0\"}},\"temporalCoverage\":\"Fri Jan 01 00:03:00 GMT 2016 / Thu Jan 31 00:12:00 GMT 2019\",\"thumbnailUrl\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/s3_sral.png\",\"encodingFormat\":\"SENTINEL-SAFE\",\"description\":\"SRAL Level 1B: Complex echoes (In-phase (I) and Quadrature (Q)) for the Low Resolution Mode (LRM) and/or Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) mode both for C Band and Ku band. When the altimeter is in SAR mode, this product also contains the so-called Pseudo LRM (PLRM) echoes. Sentinel-3 is part of a series of Sentinel satellites, under the umbrella of the EU Copernicus programme.\\r\\n\\r\\nThis collection contains reprocessed data from baseline collection 004. Operational data can be found in the corresponding collection.\",\"identifier\":\"EO:EUM:DAT:0584\",\"name\":\"SRAL Level 1B (version BC004) - Sentinel-3 - Reprocessed\"}"

#> [1] "EO:EUM:DAT:MULT:HIRSL1"
#> 
#> [[9]]$`_score`
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> [[9]]$`_source`
#> [[9]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "The High Resolution Infrared Sounder (HIRS) operates at 20 channels (19 channels in the infrared and one in the visible). Its main purpose is to provide input for the vertical temperature and humidity profile retrievals. In addition, the HIRS pixel resolution serves as the standard grid resolution for all ATOVS level 2 products.\r\n\r\nMetop-A data are available in the Data Centre up to 15/11/2021."
#>

codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty></gmd:CI_Citation></gmd:citation><gmd:abstract><gco:CharacterString>The High Resolution Infrared Sounder (HIRS) operates at 20 channels (19 channels in the infrared and one in the visible). Its main purpose is to provide input for the vertical temperature and humidity profile retrievals. In addition, the HIRS pixel resolution serves as the standard grid resolution for all ATOVS level 2 products.&#xD;\n&#xD;\nMetop-A data are available in the Data Centre up to 15/11/2021.</gco:CharacterString></gmd:abstract><gmd:status><gmd:MD_ProgressCode codeList=\"http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode\" #> [1] "{\"@context\":\"http://schema.org/\",\"@type\":\"Dataset\",\"url\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/product/EO:EUM:DAT:MULT:HIRSL1\",\"measurementTechnique\":\"Sounder\",\"copyrightHolder\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"creator\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"dateModified\":\"Thu Jan 21 00:09:00 GMT 2010\",\"isAccessibleForFree\":\"true\",\"keywords\":\"Native,Metop,HIRS,Atmosphere,LEO,Level 1 Data,Sounder\",\"license\":\"https://eoportal.eumetsat.int/userMgmt/terms.faces\",\"publisher\":{\"@type\":\"Organization\",\"name\":\"EUMETSAT\",\"contactPoint\":{\"@type\":\"ContactPoint\",\"contactType\":\"customer support\",\"telephone\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3660/3770\",\"email\":\"ops@eumetsat.int\",\"url\":\"http://www.eumetsat.int\",\"faxNumber\":\"+49(0)6151-807 3790\"}},\"schemaVersion\":\"3.5\",\"spatialCoverage\":{\"@type\":\"Place\",\"geo\":{\"@type\":\"GeoShape\",\"polygon\":\"-180.0  90.0  180.0  -90.0\"}},\"thumbnailUrl\":\"https://navigator.eumetsat.int/preview/hirs.jpg\",\"encodingFormat\":\"Native\",\"description\":\"The High Resolution Infrared Sounder (HIRS) operates at 20 channels (19 channels in the infrared and one in the visible). Its main purpose is to provide input for the vertical temperature and humidity profile retrievals. In addition, the HIRS pixel resolution serves as the standard grid resolution for all ATOVS level 2 products.\\r\\n\\r\\nMetop-A data are available in the Data Centre up to 15/11/2021.\",\"identifier\":\"EO:EUM:DAT:MULT:HIRSL1\",\"name\":\"HIRS Level 1B - Metop - Global\"}"

#> [[10]]$`_ignored`
#> [[10]]$`_ignored`[[1]]
#> [1] "dateStamp"
#> 
#> 
#> [[10]]$`_source`
#> [[10]]$`_source`$abstract
#> [1] "Rectified (level 1.5) Meteosat SEVIRI image data. The data is transmitted as High Rate transmissions in 12 spectral channels. Level 1.5 image data corresponds to the geolocated and radiometrically pre-processed image data, ready for further processing, e.g. the extraction of meteorological products. Any spacecraft specific effects have been removed, and in particular, linearisation and equalisation of the image radiometry has been performed for all SEVIRI channels. The on-board blackbody data has been processed. Both radiometric and geometric quality control information is included."

#> [[10]]$`_source`$fulltext
#> [1] "EO:EUM:DAT:0160 http://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/IG/ert/iso639.htm eng http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode series theme.par.Atmosphere theme.par.Land theme.par.Level_1_Data theme.par.Ocean dis.View sat.MSG view.Satellite.MSG 0DEG.Channels view.Theme.Atmospheric Composition European Organisation for the Exploitation of Meteorological Satellites EUMETSAT +49(0)6151-807 3660/3770 +49(0)6151-807 3790 EUMETSAT Allee 1 Darmstadt Hessen 64295 Germany ops@eumetsat.int http://www.eumetsat.int http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/ML_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ScopeCode pointOfContact pointOfContact 2020-03-11 ISO19115 2003/Cor.1:2006 High Rate SEVIRI WV6.2 μm Image - MSG - 0 degree HRSEVIRI MSG15 2009-03-23 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_DateTypeCode creation 2010-09-21 http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_DateTypeCode revision EO:EUM:DAT:0160 https://www.eumetsat.int/media/45126 MSG Level 1.5 Image Data Format Description http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode information http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode author Rectified (level 1.5) Meteosat SEVIRI image data. The data is transmitted as High Rate transmissions in 12 spectral channels. Level 1.5 image data corresponds to the geolocated and radiometrically pre-processed image data, ready for further processing, e.g. the extraction of meteorological products. Any spacecraft specific effects have been removed, and in particular, linearisation and equalisation of the image radiometry has been performed for all SEVIRI channels. The on-board blackbody data has been processed. Level 1.5 Image Data Format Description</gco:CharacterString></gmd:name><gmd:function><gmd:CI_OnLineFunctionCode codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_OnLineFunctionCode\" codeListValue=\"information\"/></gmd:function></gmd:CI_OnlineResource></gmd:onlineResource></gmd:CI_Contact></gmd:contactInfo><gmd:role><gmd:CI_RoleCode codeList=\"http://standards.iso.org/ittf/PubliclyAvailableStandards/ISO_19139_Schemas/resources/Codelist/gmxCodelists.xml#CI_RoleCode\" codeListValue=\"author\"/></gmd:role></gmd:CI_ResponsibleParty></gmd:citedResponsibleParty></gmd:CI_Citation></gmd:citation><gmd:abstract><gco:CharacterString>Rectified (level 1.5) Meteosat SEVIRI image data. The data is transmitted as High Rate transmissions in 12 spectral channels. Level 1.5 image data corresponds to the geolocated and radiometrically pre-processed image data, ready for further processing, e.g. the extraction of meteorological products. Any spacecraft specific effects have been removed, and in particular, linearisation and equalisation of the image radiometry has been performed for all SEVIRI channels. The on-board blackbody data has been processed. Both radiometric and geometric quality control information is included.</gco:CharacterString></gmd:abstract><gmd:status><gmd:MD_ProgressCode codeList=\"http://navigator.eumetsat.int/metadata_schema/eum/resources/Codelist/eum_gmxCodelists.xml#MD_ProgressCode\" The data is transmitted as High Rate transmissions in 12 spectral channels. Level 1.5 image data corresponds to the geolocated and radiometrically pre-processed image data, ready for further processing, e.g. the extraction of meteorological products. Any spacecraft specific effects have been removed, and in particular, linearisation and equalisation of the image radiometry has been performed for all SEVIRI channels. The on-board blackbody data has been processed. Both radiometric and geometric quality control information is included.\",\"identifier\":\"EO:EUM:DAT:0160\",\"name\":\"High Rate SEVIRI WV6.2 μm Image - MSG - 0 degree \"}"
